TopicTitle: FAR Fighter Challenge: BD Armory AI

Articles.Content: Alright, the X-18 is in final stage testing...

I'm not really getting why we'd want to give twin-engine ships twice as many countermeasures as single-engine ships. The twin-jet crew already has the advantage of better acceleration; why do they need a further boost?

One chaff/flare per ship seems to be working well; a fast ship with room to turn can reliably avoid missiles, but they're deadly when the target is low and slow.

I dont know I was thinking from the stand point of the heat plume from two engines vs one engine.

And that last fight was REAL short, that surprised me a lot.

The X-18 Deception. Your eyes will deceive you when you lay your gaze upon it. "Wha-wha, but that thing is too unstable!" you blurt. Ah-Ah-Ah! It will kill the F-119.

I hope.

Link: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B588M8xKv0QKVEwxM3NoX3hzdjA

Sorry if I sound impatient.

The X-18 Deception. Your eyes will deceive you when you lay your gaze upon it. "Wha-wha, but that thing is too unstable!" you blurt. Ah-Ah-Ah! It will kill the F-119.

I just ran the X-18 vs the F-119 three times. Each time, the X-18 airframe cracked up while pulling out of a low-altitude dive. Up the wing strength and add a few strategically placed struts?
Did you mean you'd do it? 'Cause it's dead of night here. And I thought strength WAS at 2.
I'm too dumb to find the problem...

Did you mean you'd do it? 'Cause it's dead of night here. And I thought strength WAS at 2.

Are the wings connected to the aircraft body or to something else and then the body?

Directly to the body. Offset further inside to make wingspan smaller.

I love space-tape.

this is my d-6: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ojh75jh9m8vuz45/d-6.craft?dl=0

Hopefully is doesn't have any problems and I believe it obeys all all the rules.
Space tape is love, space tape is life.

Did you mean you'd do it? 'Cause it's dead of night here. And I thought strength WAS at 2.

You'll need to fix it yourself; I don't want to get into tuning designs for folks.

It's as much in how it flies as how tough it is, though; check the F-119. Keeping the turns smooth (i.e. no surging, no wild rolling or yawing) would help a fair bit.

Spacetape works too, however. Just remember to bury your struts (use the offset tools) if you don't want them causing drag, and keep in mind that they aren't weightless.

You'll need to fix it yourself; I don't want to get into tuning designs for folks.

It's as much in how it flies as how tough it is, though; check the F-119. Keeping the turns smooth (i.e. no surging, no wild rolling or yawing) would help a fair bit.

Spacetape works too, however. Just remember to bury your struts (use the offset tools) if you don't want them causing drag, and keep in mind that they aren't weightless.

Funny thing is I was going to say the same about your craft and the F3C, those are great examples to follow for designs. They are smooth, fly great, and are amazingly agile aircraft.

Do i see romance in this thread? Oooooooooooooooooooooooooooh.

Just Kiddin.

OK, got it right this time. I've set the 'firing delay' or whatever it's called to 1, because I find the AI isn't always trigger happy enough for my taste. I can change it back to 12 if that's a problem.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/wk9mwrwbdu3gxpo/K-3%20Skua%20%28dogfight%29.craft?dl=0

Two reminders:

* No more than one each of chaff/flare per ship.

* In a close-matched fight, fuel capacity matters. Try to carry at least 10 minutes' worth of juice unless you're confident that you can make a fast kill.

OK, got it right this time. I've set the 'firing delay' or whatever it's called to 1, because I find the AI isn't always trigger happy enough for my taste. I can change it back to 12 if that's a problem.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/wk9mwrwbdu3gxpo/K-3%20Skua%20%28dogfight%29.craft?dl=0

Altered firing delays are fine, BTW; shaving it down means that you'll fire your missiles in a rapid volley instead of widely-spaced shots. Can be good, can be bad; personal preference rules.

(the sound is a bit messed up on the second half of that one, unfortunately)

What a nailbiter! And a tragicomic ending. I agree that the D-6 is a cool-looking plane. It's also ridiculously agile.
